Cool beans my fellow Athasian. I happen to have created a few weapons for my own 5e Dark Sun campaign. You may find them interesting. The added conditions are described at the bottom.
Weapons
Bone shiv this light, fineness weapon deals 1d4 piercing damage, has the breakable and the unbalanced property. If you make a successful attack against a creature using the bone shiv, you may use a bonus action to attempt an athletics check (DC 10) to break the bone shiv off inside your enemy. If successful, the enemy will take 1d4 piercing damage when they begin their movement for their turn until they use their action to remove it. Costs 5 clay coins.
Carrikal made from the limb of a large insect like creature, this weapon resembles a heavy scimitar with a serrated blade and a handle wrapped in cloth. This weapon has the (unbalanced) property and deals 1d8 slashing damage (+ str mod) on a hit. Costs 10 obsidian shards
Chatka an obsidian throwing weapon used commonly by the thri keen, it resembles a black three pointed star and can be used as a stabbing weapon or thrown. (30/60) Finnese, light. 1d4 (+modifier) piercing. (Martial) Costs 10 obsidian shards
Dathek A bludgeoning weapon made primarily from the bone of a large wasteland creature and a large rock chipped into the shape of a hammer. This weapon has the unbalanced, breakable, and heavy two handed properties. On a hit, this weapon deals 2d6 (+mod) bludgeoning damage. (Martial) Costs 30 obsidian shards
Kethlek A bludgeoning weapon created using a cylinder composed of leather and bone. A strong cord of animal hide about two feet long connects it to a bone handle. Wielders of this weapon have learned to swing it at wicked speeds and brutal accuracy. Damage dealt is equal to 1d8+strength modifier bludgeoning damage. This weapon has the (breakable) property. Costs 15 obsidian shards
Raider's Javelins These weapons have exactly the same properties as the Raiders spears but without being versatile. Costs 5 clay coins
Scyphek These incredibly sharp obsidian weapons are delicate, but they provide considerable damage and deadly accuracy when used properly. Most commonly found in the hands of Elven killers, The weapon resembles a curved dagger with a long black blade. This weapon has the finesse, light and breakable properties. It deals 1d6 (+mod) slashing damage. (Martial) Costs 20 obsidian shards
Sling As seen in the player's handbook. Costs 5 clay coins
Raider's spear This spear crafted from various materials found around the wastes of Athas deals 1d6 (+mod)damage when wielded with one hand or thrown(20/60) and 1d8 (+mod) when used with two hands. This weapon has the breakable and unbalanced properties. If you have proficiency with spears, you have proficiency with the raider's spear. Costs 8 clay coins
Knuckle razors A gauntlet attached to the fist with razor sharp obsidian blades sticking out of it. While wearing this weapon, you can change the damage type of unarmed attacks to slashing, and change the damage to 1d4 plus strength modifier. You must take this weapon off before you can hold or interact with an object in that hand. If your character has proficiency with unarmed strikes they are proficient with knuckle razors. Costs 2 obsidian shards
Whip As seen in the player's handbook. Costs 3 obsidian shards
(Breakable) On a natural one attack roll, an additional attack must be made. After the affects of the attack have take place this weapon breaks and is considered unusable. Using certain materials your DM may allow you to make a check to repair the item.
(Unbalanced) attacks made with this weapon suffer a -1 on the attack roll. This works in conjunction with any other attack modifiers you might have. This does not affect the damage of the weapon.
Note: clay coins are equal to silver coins and obsidian shards are equal to gold coins.

WRITING.TITLE: Efreeti warlock patron
WRITING.TEXT:
Your patron is a powerful genie from the elemental plane of fire. Most of your power manifests in flame, but you have some control over the other elements as well.
Expanded spell list
1st level: Burning hands, feather fall 2nd level: flame blade, scorching Ray 3rd level: fire ball, gaseous form 4th level: conjure minor elementals, wall of fire 5th level:contact other plane, flame strike.
Fiery altercation At first level, you can choose to change the damage type of any cantrip you cast, to fire. Also, any time you reduce a creature's hit points to zero using fire damage, you gain temporary hit points equal to your charisma modifier + your warlock level.
Level 6 Chains of the Efreeti Using your action,choose a target with 60 feet that you can see. Chains of hot metal shoot up from the ground and grab hold of the target. If the target is huge or smaller, they are considered grappled. The target takes 1d6 fire damage. On the start of the target's next turn they take 1d6 fire damage and must make a check to escape the grapple against your warlock spell save DC. If they succeed, they break the chains and are free. If they fail, the chains pull them to the ground. They are considered prone. On the start of every turn that they are still trapped, they take 1d6 fire damage and must repeat the saving throw. If this affect has persisted for 3 rounds and the target has still not escaped, the chains melt away.
Level 14 Cast into the conflagration. You can use your action to tap a creature and teleport them to the sea of flame in the elemental plane of fire. The target takes 10d10 fire damage. The creature reappears in one round. Any flammable clothing or items that the creature was wearing or carrying are either incinerated or severely burned. If the creature dies from the damage they are completely incinerated. They will return as a pile of ash. Once you have used this ability you must take a long rest before you can use it again.
Note: I know that giving warlocks access to a spell such as "conjure minor elementals" is rarely a good idea. My plan to avoid them abusing this is to have the different batches of elementals summoned dislike each other. And immediately break out into battle.

WRITING.TITLE: I'm planning a one shot and I need ideas.
WRITING.TEXT: I will be running a one off campaign for four players within the week and I need a cool idea. The characters will be a half elf warlock of an efreeti, a thri-kreen psion, an elf wizard bent on assassinating a sorcerer king and stealing his throne, and one other who has yet to be identified. Right now I'm planning to have them start at 4th level but that is changeable. Any help is appreciated.
